intro: Dugandiodendron domingense, commonly known as the Dominican ironwood, is a rare and endangered tree native to the Dominican Republic. It is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and thick, woody trunk, which contributes to its common name. The plant belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is known for its slow growth and long lifespan. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to habitat loss, it faces significant conservation challenges.
